title: Television Interview
description: Simulate a live broadcast interview testing candidate composure, messaging consistency, and adaptability under pressure. Television exposure can significantly influence voter perception.
purpose: Practice communicating clearly and persuasively on live television, managing policy and 'gotcha' questions while maintaining campaign identity and credibility.
readingSummary: 1. Structured responses → Keep answers open, concise, and aligned with campaign identity.
2. Adapting to phases → Transition smoothly from soft to policy to challenging questions.
3. Composure under pressure → Avoid overreacting, stay authentic, and maintain credibility.
- Softball Opening → Light discussion (weather, school visit recaps).
- Policy Questions → Community safety, local priorities, and national policy issues.
- 'Gotcha' Phase → Moderator presses on opponent positions or controversial topics.
- Closing Challenge → Reiterate your positions consistently and confidently.

tasks.prompt: Participate in an AI-simulated live television interview. Respond to all phases clearly and authentically.

phases.description: Begin with light, conversational topics like weather or your recent school visit.
phases.evaluation: Assesses warmth, approachability, and natural delivery.

phases.description: Address community safety, local priorities, and key national policy concerns.
phases.evaluation: Assesses policy knowledge, clarity, and alignment with campaign identity.

phases.description: Moderator asks difficult or provocative questions based on opponent positions or controversies.
phases.evaluation: Assesses composure, adaptability, and ability to stay on message under pressure.

phases.description: Reaffirm your campaign’s identity and message consistency with confidence and clarity.
phases.evaluation: Assesses persuasiveness, consistency, and leadership presence.

tasks.evaluation: AI evaluates clarity, persuasiveness, composure, authenticity, and voter approval impact.

outcome.description: Multi-phase interview performance evaluated → Voter approval updated. Candidate demonstrates messaging consistency, composure, and credibility under live broadcast conditions. CC may be awarded for clear, persuasive, and authentic responses.
